intro: Crepis froelichiana subsp. froelichiana, commonly known as the Froelich's hawk's-beard, is a flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its yellow composite flowers and a basal rosette of linear, silver-haired leaves. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils in alpine and subalpine regions. It has a compact growth habit and is often found in mountainous areas of Europe. This subspecies is notable for its ornamental value and ecological role in its native habitat.
